intro: Gonocormus alagensis, commonly known as the Alagensian spurge, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and unique floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils, often in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, with a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. The species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptations and potential medicinal properties.
